Key Match Events: Brandon Miller's putback at the buzzer gave the Charlotte Hornets a 108-107 victory against the Detroit Pistons.
Miles Bridges scored 27 points and LaMelo Ball scored five of his 25 points in the final minute to help the Hornets end a three-game losing streak.
Ronald Holland II's steal and basket in the final 10 seconds put the Pistons in position to win before Charlotte's time-out.
Jaden Ivey scored 21 points and Cade Cunningham recorded a triple-double with 20 points, 10 rebounds, and 10 assists for the Pistons.
Ball's 3-point basket gave the Hornets a 104-103 lead with 55.2 seconds left, followed by a driving floater to boost the margin to three points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Hornets made all 16 of their free throw attempts during the game, while the Pistons were 5-for-9 at the foul line.
Detroit lost center Jalen Duren to an injured left ankle after just eight minutes of playing time.
